review.body: **ARC provided in exchange for an honest review.**

Reads Like a Dry History Book

The author knows his stuff, but instead of an entertaining fantasy novel of the English battling to control the magical land of Ireland in the 14th century you get something very slow, terribly wordy and lacking any likable characters. It's painful to wade through thi...

review.body: This is for older readers, but if you like mature comedy than this book is for you

The fourth book of an amazing series. This time it felt like going home, like putting on my comfiest pyjamas and chatting with old friends. The plot is great and keeps you in suspense right through, not only are you routing for the love connections to happen but also to find out the secrets of Po...

review.body: Always fun to read about where you live
I loved the layout of this book. I haven't really been into the Vampire scene, but I'm one I won't knock until I try it and I'm so glad I did. Stefany kept me intrigued and wanting more.

book.title: The Boy in the Black Suit

review.body: The is the second book by Reynolds I've read that completely disregards the adage that a YA story must be All About Plot. Unlike the knitting one, I did not get bored and enjoyed wandering through these character's lives, and especially liked attending so many interesting funerals.
A bitter little story, with a brilliant message.
Loved, loved, loved this book!

book.title: The Boy in the Striped Pajamas

review.body: this is book is good but I think it is to fast
y
Excellent book, based on true events. Learned a lot & enjoyed the writing and story.

The Threshold starts with the last will and testament floating into the street from a house thought to be long abandoned. It is the owners last day and he has no one to leave his house to. His note states that the first person to spend a night in the house and leave it again will inherit. And it...
